title: Riot, Stop Making Everything A Skillshot or Delayed
body:
You keep doing it in the name of "counterplay." You know what's not going to have counterplay pretty soon?

Champs with mobility, because there's just going to be no way to hit them.

replies.body: I agree, there's nothing inherently wrong with targeted spells or CC, as long as the range is short enough to balance it. With champions become more and more mobile, Riot should at least maintain the current set of targeted spell champions. Pantheon is a classic example, apart from his ult is skill set basically exists to delete squishy mobile champions. This is a good thing, as it allows him to have a niche that he can be appropriately played to.

What's your stance on the Veigar changes? I'd love you opinion on that.

I haven't really looked deeply into it, but as I understand it his Q is a skillshot similar to Lux Q (without the CC but with the AP stacking) and his E takes longer to cast, while his ult has lower AP ratio to compensate for easier Q farming. Sorry if I'm wrong, I haven't seen the notes since this morning and can't bother rechecking.

I think the change is healthy. His "press R to delete" ulti is still intact, which will help him deal with mobile champs. It remains to be seen how hard the E delay will hurt, but honestly the Q buff was much needed and as long as the skillshot isn't too "thin" I think Veigar will come out stronger than before.

My comment was more focused on targeted skills in general. I think Riot's doing a good job with the reworks, but I think it's silly for their "goal" to be to remove targeted CC/targeted spells in general.

The problem with the E change is that he can no longer effectively use it to defend himself or, with skill, land the stun instantly.  His best case scenario is now to center a champion inside of it so that it pops up and confines them to that area.  I feel like Dark Matter should have a slightly increased AoE to compensate, allowing him to Dark Matter in the middle of the stun zone and force the champion caught in it to choose between big damage or getting stunned.
The E will hurt badly. i've been engineering lately and If there's one thing I know, 0.75 is actually quite a bit. That delay sucks on a champion that relays on that ability.

I just played a round with him on the PBE and I think Riot is on the right track. the Q is really nice, W is pretty much the same, I just have a problem with the E. 
The warning is much to long. Enemies rarely get caught in it. However, because of its delay you can make some nice plays with it. I think they should lower the delay just a tiny bit, maybe down to 0.6 seconds. Then I will be content. He's been nerfed because he cant delete people quite as well anymore, but now he's able to make plays, he's fun to play, and he's still really good.

Give targeted spells short range.
Give mobility champions short range.
Give skill shots long range.
VoilÃ ! You have a better balanced game.

I'm not a CoD brat. I don't have lightning reflexes. I can't play all these new champs that rely on skill shot line nukes. It's why I've been maining vlad and veigar recently. They don't need to have precise aim. Just dropping a stun in the general direction, or positioning my champ just right is all I can muster. Why does riot see fit to remove the champs I can actually play well in favor of all the CoD brats in diamond?

Its not being a CoD brat. Having lighting reflexes is a skill needed to be good at this game. I do feel that there can be a healthy mix of targeted and skillshots, but don't bitch because you don't have the skillset to be good.

reflexes are not some kind of skill that you can develop. You can train them to some extent. but each human has certain limits of reactivity. The older you get, the less responsive your reflexes become. I've never had great reflexes to begin with, but they are steadily getting worse with each passing year, and I'd very much like to continue to play this game with champs that I can still perform well with.

does that mean I must also forfeit my right to enjoy the game? These high skill cap high skill floor champs are not enjoyable.

It sets aprart the people who honestly care enough to learn champs as opposed to the people who just derp around. And if you play more you should be rewarded with a better experience IMO. It's how they reward dedication.

Well, not to be too harsh, but that's why lower ELOs exist. If your reflexes are actually so bad that it's compromising your ability to enjoy the game, you'll move down in the ranks until you're with people who are about on your level. You can't expect the entire game to shift and evolve around your (apparently exceptional) personal traits.

I just can't wait until they make Ryze's Q a skillshot so his full combo has 6 skillshots in it. While completely wrecking his current farming pattern.

Meanwhile his E is gonna be left untouched and remain the spell you toss out there to get some extra CDR on your other spells.

lol, hey, one benifit (and prolly the only one) to his Ryze's Q becoming a skillshot. He can build Tear without a target finally.

Just chuck them stawbarry snowballs everywhere

True, but they could give the skillshot treatment to his E instead (which seems much more natural in that it alreeady kinda resembles a boomerang skillshot). Leaving him his Q to farm with, and introducing the interesting decision of whether to go for an extra Q once you root them with W or push your E out when you know it'll hit.

I think if they manage to make his E more interactive, make it require some subset of targeting and positioning to get out it's full damage potential, and push some of the power from his Qs over into his E(s), then you have a Ryze who still plays like Ryze, but now you have interesting play to attempt (or not if you don't wanna risk getting to the needed position) and zoning-related counterplay.

In the big rework announcement post, it was said that Q was an "obvious candidate" for skillshotifying, giving it increased range in return. I fail to see how this is the obvious option, seeing as his short combo will then have 3 skillshots and his long combo will have 6, as well as his only farming ability being renedered all but useless for it (unless they let it pass through minions, which doesn't sound like his Overload(Q) at all).
Uhm, what other ability is a skill shot? I thought they were all point and click.

*facepalm*

His combo has a q between every other ability cast.

we need counterplay !!!

Every time they say "Counterplay is needed" I ask what is the "counterplay" to Kalista's passive. Considering that now everything is a skillshot.

They also say that the bits that make a champ genuinely unique are left relatively untouched, and that's actually kinda true in most cases. Perfect example, Lucian: they faffed around with his kit FOREVER before finally giving up and realize that the lightslinger passive was just straight OP, and nerfed it hard enough for him to disappear rather than try something else.

GP's Q is the reason you play GP: melee effects at range and dat bank. I just don't see them changing that.

You can never tell with bipolar rito. (we want diversity but refuse to nerf the 3 jungles that are exclusively played throughout all ranks and modes, and instead make sweeping nerfs that ONLY hurt every other jungler)

They do have some Cred as far as what GP's rework can yield with the QoL buff to his Ult a little while ago. However, His kit will have to change pretty drastically if it is actually going to impact his play in the current/future meta where Mobility and Knock up/displacement dominate.

Oranges dont make you K when knocked up, and his high Move speed stacking doesn't help him for squat vs Kalista.

Weird that there are exactly three viable junglers played exclusively at every level of the game, because I'm pretty sure I play four or five with at least modest success. You may be confusing "exceptionally strong" with "only viable." There's always going to be a strongest champ for each position (very broadly speaking), but that doesn't  mean you can't use any of the others effectively.

Whenever there's a thread about her passive people just say "use targeted CC" and it's just like "well there's about three people with that left", and I imagine Lissandra will be the only person to keep it for much longer.
